metadata.title: CVE-2023-20593 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
An issue in “Zen 2” CPUs, under specific microarchitectural circumstances,may allow an attacker to potentially access sensitive information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-20593` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

amd64-microcode - 3.20191021.1+really3.20181128.1~ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-216-generic - 4.15.0-216.227
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-216-generic - 4.15.0-216.227
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-216-lowlatency - 4.15.0-216.227
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-159-generic - 5.4.0-159.176~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-159-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-159.176~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-159-lowlatency - 5.4.0-159.176~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-159-generic - 5.4.0-159.176~18.04.1

criterions.comment: amd64-microcode package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20191021.1+really3.20181128.1~ubuntu0.18.04.1+esm1').
linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-216.227').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-159.176~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1144.149').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1160.173').
